bibl.title: Letter from F.F. Randolph to Philip Showalter Hench, September 11, 1940

div1.p: Randolph informs Hench that the book on Finlay he ordered is now available.

div1.head: Letter from F.F. Randolph to Philip Showalter Hench, September 11, 1940
div1.opener:
OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS
OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS LONDON · CLARENDON PRESS OXFORD
OXFORD MEDICAL PUBLICATIONS
NEW YORK
ONE FOURTEEN FIFTH AVENUE
TELEPHONE: WATKINS 9-1100
September 11, 1940.
Dr. P. S. Hench,
102-110 Second Avenue, S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We have just published “Carlos Finlay and
Yellow Fever” by Dr. C.E. Finlay.

We have just received an airmail letter
from Dr. Finlay stating that the other day he referred
you to us regarding this new book and stated that you
were anxious to get a copy. However, the order has not
arrived and we thought best to advise that the book is
now ready and can be delivered upon receipt of your
order. The price of the work has been set at $4.00
and shipment is at our expense.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, F. F. Randolph
OXFORD UNIVERSITY PRESS
New York, Inc. FFR:AW
